channel.title: Elysia - A netty 5 framework
channel.description:
[size=16pt][b]Elsyia - A netty 5 framework by RandQm[/b][/size]
I wanted to write a netty 5 framework for a while but failed in doing so. When I saw Vix was writing one as well I wanted to try again, I was first going to reference it from him, but after all a programmer has it's own style and it wouldn't feel good so I ended up writing it myself.
[b]At the moment this includes:[/b] - Logging in - Outgoing packet system - Incoming packet system - Control panel (I love control panels)
I also plan on expanding this to an actual working server to build content on. I'm now finished with the login framework itself which you can find under github here: https://github.com/randqm/Elysia-framework
And you can also download it from the download section: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,664105.0.html
[size=14pt][b]Media:[/b][/size]
[IMG]http://i60.tinypic.com/2wnmq7q.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/2po4i83.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/21o0kz8.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/qqznti.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i58.tinypic.com/34nk38n.png[/img]
[b]For any more information don't hesitate to ask. And keep the "this is bad" comments out, instead post constructive criticism.[/b]
[b]edit:[/b] You might think where the logger, task system and attributes class are coming from when looking through the code. Those are libraries from myself which I use over multiple projects, the jars can be downloaded with source code included together with the project in the downloads sections: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,664105.0.html
Credits to Vix for some references

item.title: Elysia - A netty 5 framework
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:64, topic:545224”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=664106.msg4442033#msg4442033 date=1407002353]

I am actually a professional. Just saying.

In arrogance?

Note: Let this die.
Not continuing this project anymore as contribution isn’t appreciated anymore even there are no netty5 frameworks around as far as I know.
If you want it, it’s in the downloads section and on the github link.
Going to work on some personal projects now.

You’re kinda being a runt

Typical moparscaper, can’t take advice from someone who knows what they’re doing. We need a new plague.

What advice exactly? “contribute to davidi’s development”?

His advice of help a project that’s actually going somewhere rather than produce another useless “framework” that will never go anywhere is wise. As much as I can’t stand david, if people would fudgeing help with his project it might get somewhere rather than something as useless as this.

That’s plain bullshit, “if he helped with my project it might get somewhere as well”.
Just remove the development section if people should be helping david and not try things theirselves.

It’s not like you’ve not already made 16 projects that went to the top. Imagine putting your knowledge into something that might actually go somewhere, but once again, who’d think that.

I’m not going to sugar coat it for you, this is a pile of ass that no one really needs or wants. As if someone woke up one day and said “holy fudge, I wish I had a barebones netty 5 RSPS that only has packet handling complete and a nifty little control panel”.

It was meant to be continued to an actual server, updating was done already (not on github), and I didn’t expect somebody to use it, even if it was finished, it’s an accomplishment for myself, it’s something I WANTED TO DO, and thought it’d be nice to share in case somebody might be interested.
Why would I need to have had projects at the top to be allowed to share my project? Why would I need to contribute to a revision I’m not interested in because you are?
You’re just being a total ass.
[/quote]
A total ass with a valid point.[/quote]
I tried but can’t find your point?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:38, topic:545224”]I have a college degree programming .NET and Java, sure I lack experience as I didn’t work in a professional environment yet but you guys act like you’re fudgeing pro’s and that I’m just changing numbers in a PI. This is moparscape, not a professional programmers forum, so act to it. I’m at least doing my best writing something myself and learning, what can’t be said of the biggest part of this community here. How about you told me what is good and what is wrong and how it should be done better instead of just saying hur dur this is bad I could do this better but I don’t because I rather wine.[/quote]lol’d irl

item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

sinisoul:

Usually the word degree and professional are synonymous to a certain measure.

When you get off school you’re a junior programmer, it’s at the actual work-floor you can work your way up to a senior/professional.

But neither am I an idiot.
